bwwExcerpt: Not everything works in Jessica Stone’s production — there’s a reason the words “dream sequence” tend to set off alarm bells — but at least it summons a coherent theatrical universe. And more often than not, the show (whose world premiere was this past June in Atlanta) captures the unabashed mix of romance and pathos that made its source material, a bestseller by Sara Gruen, so wildly popular.

keyPhrases.quote: Not everything works in Jessica Stone's production
at least it summons a coherent theatrical universe

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The review acknowledges significant flaws but gives more weight to what works, suggesting a qualified positive recommendation despite mixed elements. | GPT-4o-mini: The review acknowledges both strengths and weaknesses, ultimately leaning towards a qualified recommendation.
